item.title: Contra Lorem Ipsum Etc
item.description:
Sed in rutrum arcu. Donec bibendum, libero ac gravida mattis, tortor eros pellentesque sapien, id viverra nisi est eu erat. Sed laoreet pulvinar urna, ut volutpat arcu porttitor vel. Duis blandit magna vitae orci interdum volutpat. Nulla ac augue ut erat mollis hendrerit. Duis pretium ultrices orci, in cursus leo tincidunt ut. Maecenas eleifend erat in bibendum pulvinar.

Mauris laoreet faucibus felis, a ullamcorper nibh tincidunt nec. Suspendisse at odio et urna euismod maximus. Nunc in sem nec neque tempus semper. Nunc a augue id ante sagittis commodo vulputate in ligula. Mauris ipsum nulla, convallis non molestie vitae, imperdiet tempor sem. Nam quam eros, facilisis id ultricies quis, lacinia eget lectus. Morbi dignissim enim vitae sem accumsan gravida. Integer malesuada, mi tempor egestas laoreet, enim turpis eleifend dolor, at sollicitudin arcu enim a urna. Sed varius, erat at pretium tristique, felis risus cursus quam, at porta dui leo non orci. Nulla accumsan et tellus ut ultrices. Donec convallis, ante vitae laoreet consectetur, ligula orci ultricies diam, id congue erat ex eu ligula. Sed congue purus vitae enim porttitor, interdum porta felis rutrum. Proin nibh nunc, dignissim sed purus sed, ullamcorper tempor metus.
What is not overtly bound by a rule is covertly ruled by chance.

Real life doesn’t care about human narrative conventions.
It’s one of its few redeeming qualities.

Pyramid scheme where the business model is “teaching how to setup pyramid schemes”. The instructors take a cut from the pyramid schemes their clients set up.

If someone asks “wait, isn’t this a pyramid scheme?” the reply is always “of course it is! But it is YOUR pyramid scheme.”. Everyone believes they are near the top because they are all being so open about the fact that they are making pyramid schemes.

I would totally make a deal with the devil from the classic folktale Don’t Make A Deal With The Devil, No, Seriously, Even If You Think You Are Too Clever To Listen To Classic Folktales About Making Deals With The Devil because I’m too clever to listen to classic folktales about making deals with the devil.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
I go by Wotton / わたん / ParaPri / Paraconsistent Prior.
I’m obsessed with reasoning.

e-mail

There once was a mail address
that bots were eager to guess.
“public” its name
at this domain.
(The domain where you found this verse)
